RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui doutorado em Matemática pela Universidade Estadual de Campinas (1988). Atualmente é professor da Uiniversidad Católica del Norte, Chile. Colaborador da Universidade Estadual de Campinas e Universidade Federal do Amazonas no Brasil, Iowa Sate University em USA, Rouen University na France, Augsburg University na Alemanha e pesquisador - Comisión Nacional de Investigación Científica y Tecnológica de Chile. Tem experiência na área de Matemática, com ênfase em Teoría Geométrica do Controle, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: sistemas lineares em grupos de Lie: controlabilidade, optimalidade e quivalencia de sistemas. Estruturas quase-Riemannianas e sistemas de controle e temas relacionados.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: doctorate at Mathematics from Universidade Estadual de Campinas (1988). Has experience in Mathematics, focusing on Mathematics, acting on the following subjects: geometric control theory on Lie groups: controllablity, Pontryagin maximum principle. Quase-Riemannian structure and relates topics.

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES: Aficionado ao Jazz, dirige o Sexteto de Jazz Standar Cónclave, no Chile.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Linear Control Systems on Lie Groups. Sub-Riemannian Geometry. Optimality and Semigroups
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The main aim of the proposal is to give a contribution to the Differential Geometry Control System Theory, through the class of Linear Control Systems on Lie Groups (LCS). This class of system was introduced by our team in [5]. The project contains a number of open problems from both, new and old challenges. The proposal is based on a series of papers, coming from our previous Fondecyt projects, see [5] up to [27], and the unpublished research mentioned in the Work in Progress section of the project. Next, we list the specific goals of the proposal through six different but some of theme related problems. I. Almost Riemannian and SubRiemannian Structures (ARS, SRE). It turns out that a LCS is a bonafide family of ARS. First, we would like to understand this structure. To work out the associated "metric" and the normal topics related, for instance the geodesics. In particular, on Lie groups of low dimension. Second, any ARS can be lifted to a sub-Riemannian structure, a geometry closely related to optimal control theory, see [1] up to [4]. In fact, we already now that an ARS can be lifted to Sub- Riemannian structure. We propose to explore this situation deeply, by the lifting and the projection. Furthermore, we also propose to begin a very hard challenge: to explore the existence of a meaning for a Gauss-Bonnett or/and a Gauss-Bonnet-Chern theorem for a LCS, if something like that really exists, see the article A Gauss Bonnet-like formula on two-dimensional almost-Riemannian manifolds, [4]. II. Optimal Control for LCS. The time-optimal and quadratic ones, are always at the heart of control problems, they light up the essential controllability question. We expect to establish the Pontryagin Maximum Principle for LCS. We also need a version of this principal to compute the geodesics of an ARS. III. Equivalence Theorem Extensions. In [47] Jouan proved a fundamental result in our theory: a control affine system on a differentiable manifold M is equivalent by a diffeomorphism ψ to a linear system on a Lie group or a homogeneous space if and only if the vector fields of the system are complete and generate a finite dimensional Lie algebra. We expect to extend this results in several directions. From the group G to a homogeneous space G/H. From a LCS to a Singular Control System. And, for an arbitrary ARS, i.e., by considering a family {f₁,?,fn}} of vector fields on a manifold M as an orthonormal frame, when they generate a finite dimensional lie algebra. IV. Controllability and Stability of LCS and Singular Control Systems (SCS). It turns out that to characterize a global geometric property of a LCS is a real challenge. We propose to study both properties according to the different classes of Lie groups. V. Bilinear Control Systems (BCS). BCS provide a large class of systems with a wide range of applications, including nonlinear systems linearized at fixed point with respect to the variable state. Controllability of BCS has received a substantial amount of interest over the last 30 years, but general characterizations of complete controllability for this class of systems are still not available. Most of the approaches to this problem are algebraic in nature, [40]. We propose to approach this topic from Conley- Morse and Colonius-Kliemann theory, [35]. VI. Lie Semigroups and Control Systems. Any semisimple connected Lie group G is associated to a relevant class of compact cosets: Grassmannians and flag manifolds, [65]. We propose, to approach control theory from the dynamical system point of view (Lyapunov spectrum, Morse decomposition, chain recurrent components and the asymptotic behavior of the system). To analyze semigroups from their control sets. To obtain controllability results for invariant systems in low dimension of Lie groups and their homogeneous spaces. Methodology-Activities The Proposal consider a 20 hrs a week of work by the main researcher. The supervision of 2 doc
